New Records: Luka Modric became the oldest scorer in European Championship history at 38 years and 289 days with his goal in the match.
Key Match Events: Mattia Zaccagni scored a late 98th-minute equalizer to secure Italy's advancement.
Luka Modric missed a penalty but later scored the winning goal for Croatia.
Pre-Game Insights: Italy had struggled in their previous matches but managed to stay in the game with a strong second half performance.
Post-Match Reflections: Luka Modric expressed the emotional impact of the loss and the team's resilience.
Italy's coach Luciano Spalletti praised his team's effort and qualification merit.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was held at Red Bull Arena in Leipzig, Germany with an attendance of 38,322 fans.
Others: The result left Croatia on the precipice as they relied on being one of the best third-placed teams to advance.
